current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide an individual with a mental health assessment
			 before the individual enlists in the Armed Forces or is commissioned as an
			 officer in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Preliminary mental health assessments for individuals becoming members of the Armed Forces

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 section:

text.#text:
Before any individual enlists in an armed force or is commissioned as an officer in an armed force,
			 the Secretary concerned shall provide the individual with a mental health
			 assessment. The Secretary shall use such results as a baseline for any
			 subsequent mental health examinations, including such examinations
			 provided under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in determining the assignment or promotion of a member of the armed
			 forces.

text.#text: The Secretary may not consider the results of a mental health assessment conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in the same manner as the medical records of a member of
			 the armed forces.

text.#text:
With respect to applicable laws and regulations relating to the privacy of information, the
			 Secretary shall treat a mental health assessment conducted under

The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding after the item relating
			 to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Institute of
			 Mental Health of the National Institutes of Health

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on preliminary mental
			 health assessments of members of the Armed Forces.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c/p:1

text.#text:
Recommendations with respect to establishing a preliminary mental health assessment of members of
			 the Armed Forces to bring mental health screenings to parity with physical
			 screenings of members.

Recommendations with respect to the composition of the mental health assessment, best practices,
			 and how to track assessment changes relating to traumatic brain injuries,
			 post-traumatic stress disorder, and other conditions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the surgeons general of the military departments,
			 and other relevant experts.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for Disease
			 Control and Prevention

header.#text:
Physical examinations and mental health screenings for certain members undergoing separation from
			 the Armed Forces who are not otherwise eligible for such examinations

text.#text:
The Secretary of the military department concerned shall provide a comprehensive physical
			 examination (including a screening for Traumatic Brain Injury) and a
			 mental health screening to each member of the Armed Forces who, after a
			 period of active duty of more than 180 days, is undergoing separation from
			 the Armed Forces and is not otherwise provided such an examination or
			 screening in connection with such separation from the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not, by itself, be used to determine the eligibility of the member
			 for any health care benefits
			 from the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: The provision of a physical examination or mental health screening to a member under

header.#text: No right to health care benefits

text.#text:
Funds for the provision of physical examinations and mental health screenings under this section
			 shall be derived from funds otherwise authorized to be appropriated for
			 the military department concerned for the provision of health care to
			 members of the Armed Forces.

header.#text:
Report on capacity of Department of Defense to provide electronic copy of member service treatment
			 records to members separating from the Armed Forces

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report setting forth an assessment of the
			 capacity of the

to provide each member of the Armed
			 Forces who is undergoing separation from the Armed Forces an electronic
			 copy of the member’s  service treatment record at the time of separation.

text.#text: Not later than six months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with regards to members of the National Guard shall include an
			 assessment of the capacity of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medical Evaluation Parity for Servicemembers Act of 2014/s:4/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to ensure that the electronic
			 copy of a member’s service treatment record includes health records
			 maintained by each State or territory in which the member served.

header.#text: Matters relating to the National Guard
